message:
I saw a creepy trend, Like instead of being a developer or sw engineer, or QA Engineer "Engineer in test", I see now a C# Developer or a .Not Developer, and even more radical like ASP CRM Developer or Share Point 2012 Developer and yes he he specifies a version..

What wrong with people ?

data.message: I think tied yourself with specific framework or company.
Or maybe a training course or certificate
Actually, sometimes you just need a guy who knows CRM and knows the business of CRM. Not just anyone who can write code is good with those frameworks and knows how to use them.
In the end you should learn a framework for work, but keep your hands tied with Algorithms and implementations to sharpen your saw :)
وليه يقول مهندس برمجيات.. يكفي إنه يقول "إنسان" :D :P (موسيقى في الخلفية لإنننننسان جواااك وجوايا .. )

Stupid indeed! Next thing we will hear of a visual studio 2010 developer! Stupid HR people who know nothing about software engineering yet they think they can come up with a "Job description " similar to ones they come up with to an accountant or a salesman

nothing is creepy in that , the fact is the base is one , but it's hard to be all in one
 i started with java for a few years then i turned to the dot net, yes the c# is typical to the java in the codding , but in the technique  they are totally different, i can't call myself a java developer unless i go back to follow what happened in the last 9 years with the java
it can't be one man show

مش فاهم ؟!! يعني انا لو عينتك وطلبت منك انك تكتب 
Kernel driver
او 
OpenGL
او 
Direct X

وانت ماعرفتش .. تبقي مش مبرمج ؟!!!

 don't play smart and be easy on yourself

Mohamed Samy being an expert in certain domain is another dimension, stick yourself to a framework is something seriously wrong, I consider myself as software developer specially in web technologies and have good experience in ERP domain.

There is nothing wrong with saying, I am a developer specialized in C#, Objective C ..etc

This is how it goes now.. if you want to be a universal developer, then good luck :)
Is it okay to see Sharepoint 2012 developer ?

Bottom line developer is someone who know how to solve users problems with his tools, .NET can solve some problems better than Java, maybe Python can solve problems better than .NET, you who has the choice to use which framework and if you have more than one framework in your arsenal, this will make you better developer.
BTW there's no SharePoint 2012, SP 2010 or SP 2013
^ I saw 2012 deh fe job ad wallhy =D, I got like "WTF".

Emad Mokhtar Habib I agree with most of what you say, but there is a big difference between someone who has never done any SP development no matter how smart and someone who has 3 years of SP experience. Same with Joomla, Drupal and DNN. Yes you can always learn a new framework, but if you must hit the floor running , then you must be an expert already
